metadata.titel_preek: The Second Sign: The Temple Veil

kernfrasen: the curtain of the temple was torn in two
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: RELIGIOUS ACCESS IS PHYSICAL PROXIMITY WITHIN A BUILDING

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The curtain of the temple was rent in twain from top to bottom.

cognitieve_implicaties: If the wall is gone, I can walk in without permission.
theologische_implicaties: The mediation of the priesthood is obsolete.
ethische_implicaties: Believers should not create new barriers for others.
onbedoelde_consequenties: God's holiness might be perceived as 'cheap' or overly accessible.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of the 'veil' by mapping it onto modern airplane curtains and velvet ropes.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the image of the 'Curtain/Barrier' as a master-metaphor that bridges the biblical Temple, the sorority 'Rush', and the airplane cabin.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Functional equivalence: both serve to distinguish 'first class' from 'benighted masses'.

sterktes.beschrijving: Transforms a dusty biblical artifact (the veil) into a relatable modern experience (the airplane curtain).
sterktes.voorbeeld: They draw that curtain... it announces to you that there is a superior class of people.

risicos.beschrijving: The focus on social inclusion might reduce the cosmic/spiritual nature of the atonement to mere social justice.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view the Gospel as primarily a social reform movement.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The Jerusalem Temple with its concentric circles of exclusion.
sub_worlds: An Amtrak club car and airplane coach section
The high-stakes world of supermodels (Cindy Crawford)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Seamless transition using the 'curtain' as a pivot.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Detailed description of the Holy of Holies and the high priest's singular access.

verstoorde_schemas.schema_naam: God helps those who help themselves

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with a Good Friday or Passion Sunday liturgy.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'BARRIER' schema. It successfully maps the ancient Temple architecture onto modern social hierarchies (sororities, airlines, fashion). This creates a powerful cognitive bridge for the hearer to understand 'Grace' as the removal of exclusive barriers.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Remains somewhat abstract/conventional compared to the vivid 'curtain' imagery.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'sprinkling of blood' to the physical 'tearing' of the curtain more viscerally.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The blood didn't just sit on a seat; it soaked the barrier until it dissolved.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'Rush counselor' to 'Atonement' is strong, but the 'Cindy Crawford' section introduces a 'Time/Aging' metaphor that slightly distracts from the 'Access' metaphor.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Link aging to the 'curtain' by describing it as the ultimate barrier that excludes the beautiful from their status.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Implies that there is still a 'cut' being made, just with different criteria.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize that in Christ, the 'cut' itself is abolished, not just the criteria changed.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the social/relational focus with the objective reality of the 'ungodly' being justified.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to make ancient biblical concepts cognitively accessible to a modern audience.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'curtain' imagery for its beauty, CMT reveals it as a cognitive tool for redefining social identity.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning, CMT shows that the hearer doesn't just 'learn' about the veil, they 're-map' their social reality through it.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is using the 'CONTAINER' schema to explain that God is no longer 'contained' and humans are no longer 'excluded' from the divine space.

appendices.notities: The preacher effectively uses 'Verticality' (top to bottom) to emphasize divine agency in the tearing of the veil.
